title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oral Roberts University
Interview Descriptions: Easy going and well put together and with the willingness to help you find the path that you want to go down. Friendly and kind with a passion to allow for personal growth.
Interview Questions: Do you want to work here?

title: Housing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oral Roberts University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and involved different questions regarding your interest in the position. They also ask about your availability and if you understand all campus rules and policies. Lastly, they let you know that there would be training for certain situations and how to respond to different emergencies.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Brand Amabassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and very friendly. They were welcoming and wanted to get to know me as a person. Through the hiring process, it was over zoom, but once hired, the people who already worked their were very easy to get along with and jumping in was a breeze.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Oral Roberts University
Interview Descriptions: Fill out an application first. Then go through three interviews. The first two are one on one interviews with Head Resident Advisors and Hall Directors. After the two interviews, an internship happens. Then a panel interview occurs to determine if you are placed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Strengths and Weaknesses?

title: Student Accounts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with HR. They were very friendly and asked common interview questions. After that there was an interview with the specific department. They asked more specific questions related to the job.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations?

title: Housing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online process for submission. They were quick to review my qualifications. Contacted me back promptly and assisted with my understanding of the job's responsibilities. Made it clear that they value their staff and provide benefits
Interview Questions: What is one of your biggest strengths?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Completed application, HR contacted me to set-up interview, interviewed with potential supervisor, then interview with panel consisting of 5 potential coworkers. Waited about another week and received offer via phone call. Took a typing test, and went through new employee orientation and signed a lot of paperwork.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to ORU?

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took me into the room, then the supervisor asked question about yourself, major, where are you from, and then take you for the tour of the office. Ask you about your work experience as well and gives you the job description
Interview Questions: Have you had any work experience

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: There is an application paper you fill out and depending on if you have been involved in the department and have shown exceptional leadership skills, they will decide if they want to hire you or not.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for ORU Worship Center?

title: Dorm Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Wagoner, OK) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I waited a few weeks after filling in a long online application. Then I was called for an interview. Two people interviewed me together to see if I got the bill.
Interview Questions: What would I do if a student came in late and was acting out?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Honestly, I don't know why they hired me since I was quite a bit younger than the rest of the office.
Interview Questions: Can you fill in for a system manager.`

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very formal. There were three hall directors who interviewed me. At first it was a bit daunting but they made sure that I was comfortable yet professional. In the beginning of the interview they asked about me and later on got into specifics about the job description and scenarios.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was lengthy. The university loves having multipul people in on the interviews, and they almost enjoy firing "hard questions" at you. Like it is a competiton between those in the room. Very interesting as a whole.
Interview Questions: I honestly thought all of them were pretty easy.

title: "Cajero, reponedor y mozo de almacén en frutería" Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Oral Roberts University (Tulsa, OK) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a very relaxed atmosphere. I met with a three person panel in the office at the athletic department. We met fro about 2 hours and covered everything from ideas to salary to what I could bring to the table.
Interview Questions: What could I bring to their organization that others could not
